xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class NonCopiableKnowledge<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.ClassKnowledge<T>
      • xyz.acygn.mokapot.NonCopiableKnowledge<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class that this class tracks knowledge about.

    public class NonCopiableKnowledge<T>
extends ClassKnowledge<T>
    Knowledge about a class that allows us to create long references to it. This is mostly concerned with tracking the appropriate proxy classes, and is used in cases where objects of the class cannot safely be copied.

    If the class is final, we can't do this reliably; instead we have to create a long reference to the superclass and hope that the exact identity of the class never becomes relevant.

    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Method Detail

      • unmarshalsReliably

        public boolean unmarshalsReliably(boolean asField)
        Returns whether we know the class can be unmarshalled reliably. This is based on whether the "signpost class" (i.e. class that forwards methods to an actual instance of the class) could be made to extend the class itself. (In some instances we have to rely on signposts that merely implement as many of the same methods as possible, without extending the class in question; doing so is unreliable.)
        Specified by:
        unmarshalsReliably in class ClassKnowledge<T>
        Parameters:
        asField - Whether we're talking about a hypothetical object stored in a field of this class (true), or a class that inherits from or implements this class (false)
        Returns:
        Whether a fully general signpost class could be created for T.

      • unmarshalsAsCopy

        public boolean unmarshalsAsCopy()
        Always returns false. Part of our knowledge is that the class cannot be safely copied; as such, we don't use copies to unmarshal.
        Specified by:
        unmarshalsAsCopy in class ClassKnowledge<T>
        Returns:
        false.
